title: My Money: 'I'm a 33-weeks' pregnant doctor'
description: Helen Edwards, an NHS doctor from the West Midlands in the UK takes us through her week's spending.

title: US judge says parents owe son over trashed porn collection
description: The 42-year-old sued his parents, saying they threw away an "irreplaceable" collection worth $25,000.

title: Covid patient urges people not to visit family at Christmas
description: From his hospital bed, 60-year-old Chris Lea says "it is not worth losing an aunt, uncle or grandparent".

title: Quiz of the Year, part two: What went on during lockdown?
description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?

title: Brexit trade deal: What are the sticking points?
description: The negotiating teams have been working "day and night" - what are the remaining issues still to be agreed?

title: Callum Smith v Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez: An underdog champion fights a seasoned risk-taker
description: Britain's Callum Smith is the world champion many have written off when he faces Mexico's Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez on Saturday.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson 'hoping to avoid' national lockdown
description: But the PM admits Covid cases are increasing "very much", as Northern Ireland announces tough new lockdown.

title: School staff 'broken' by England's late Covid test plan
description: Last minute plans for mass testing in England's secondary schools to be run by teachers anger staff.

title: 'Just a few hours' left to agree Brexit trade deal, says Michel Barnier
description: Michel Barnier says it is now "the moment of truth", while Boris Johnson warns of "difficult" talks.

title: 'It's not about advantages, it's about player welfare' - Klopp on latest rejection of five subs
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp is critical of Premier League clubs for voting against the use of five substitutes for a third time.

title: Coronavirus infections on the rise again
description: Office for National Statistics figures suggest one in every 95 people in England has the virus.

title: Greater Manchester Police failings: Andy Burnham 'should resign'
description: Andy Burnham is facing a call to stand down as Greater Manchester Police is put in special measures.

title: Australia collapse as India open up lead in first Test
description: India take the upper hand as 15 wickets fall on day two of a fast-moving first Test against Australia in Adelaide.

title: Hampshire 'toxic' police unit officers guilty of gross misconduct
description: Investigators secretly recorded "offensive" conversations between members of the unit.

title: Sports Personality of the Year: Jordan Henderson on dedication needed to win title
description: Sports Personality of the Year contender Jordan Henderson pays tribute to his team-mates and manager Jurgen Klopp after Liverpool won their first top-flight title in 30 years.

title: Arteta wants 'time' - but will Arsenal give it to him?
description: After an impressive start at Arsenal, Mikel Arteta's reign appears to have stalled. So can he fix things and will he be given time?

title: Pre-Christmas lockdown restrictions hit retail sales
description: Sales fell by 3.8% last month, bringing to an end a six-month streak of rising trade.

title: World Cup-winning captain Daley-Mclean retires from England duty
description: England's 2014 Rugby World Cup-winning captain Katy Daley-Mclean decides to retire from international rugby to spend more time with her family.

title: Nigeria school attack: Was it really Boko Haram?
description: Militant activity is spreading across northern Nigeria with other groups expressing allegiance to Boko Haram

title: Japan: Snow traps 1,000 drivers in frozen traffic jam
description: Heavy snow has left drivers stranded on a highway in Japan, some of them since Wednesday night.

title: The Papers: 'Bleakest midwinter' as Covid tiers extended
description: The extension of tier three Covid rules to more parts of England is the focus for many of Friday's front pages.

title: 'I became a full-time dad for my wife's career'
description: Take-up of shared parental leave has been slow, but some men are putting their wives' careers first.

title: Chef 'comes of age' to win Masterchef: The Professionals title
description: The winner of this year's Masterchef: The Professionals series says "it is the best feeling ever".

title: The angry pop song calling out China's domestic violence problem
description: Xiao Juan is the first pop song in China to openly discuss the sensitive topic of domestic violence.

title: Coronavirus and Christmas: Relief for family trapped in city of eternal lockdown
description: A family look forward to being reunited at Christmas, after being separated for 10 months.

title: Covid: How schools managed to save the Christmas nativity
description: Schools have found new ways of celebrating the festive period during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Burnley's Pastor Mick - from dangerous drug dealer to lifesaver
description: Pastor Mick - who helps the poor on streets of Burnley - was once a violent dealer, covering up painful childhood memories.

title: Celebrating Hanukkah and tackling anti-Semitism
description: Young Jews have marked the festival by posting videos honouring traditions and fighting anti-Semitism.

title: Quiz of the Year, part one: Can you even remember January?
description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?

title: Creating animal food from a greenhouse gas
description: Animal feed is often transported thousands of miles so scientists are looking at new production methods.

title: US couple find 100-year-old whisky bottles hidden in walls of home
description: In 1920, the US banned alcohol but bootleggers went to extraordinary lengths to hide the illicit goods.

title: Coronavirus: Swiss count cost of surge in deaths
description: Swiss leaders decide on Friday whether to impose tougher measures, as deaths reach 100 a day.

title: Covid-19: Is rule-breaking causing the surge?
description: Ros Atkins from BBC's Outside Source asks if it's people or policies behind the rising infection rates.
